svcsubproc.title: 28-Way Connector (Used With Celect Electronic Controls) - Replacing The 28-Pin Connector (International Harness Connector C263 to ECM)
svcsubproc.para: The 28-pin International engine harness connector, C263, that mates to the ECM has special "keys" so that it cannot be interchanged with the other two Cummins connectors. When replacing the connector, be sure the correct key piece is used ( Figure 79).

figure.caption: Be Sure Correct Key Piece is Used

step1.para: With International C263 removed from the electronic control module (ECM), cut and remove the plastic wire tie that holds the cover to the connector body ( Figure 80).
Pull the locking tabs apart on the cover. Remove the cover from the connector. Cut the plastic wire ties under the cover ( Figure 81).

figure.caption: Cut Plastic Wire Ties Under Cover

step1.para: Remove the number one terminal connection pin from the damaged AMP connector. Insert terminal removal tool, Cummins Part No. 3822759, in the terminal about 0.7 in. (18 mm). Push the tool to the bottom of the cavity ( Figure 82).

figure.caption: Push Tool to Bottom of Cavity

step1.para: Hold the tool in the connector and pull the terminal out of the connector. Attach a tag to the terminal connection wire and mark it number one ( Figure 83).

figure.caption: Attach Tag to Terminal Connection Wire

step1.para: Remove all of the terminals from the AMP connector labeling each terminal with the AMP cavity number as it is removed ( Figure 84).

figure.caption: Label Each Terminal as It is Removed

step1.para: Select the correct AMP replacement connector (International Part No. 1663985C1 or Cummins Part No. 3048603). Make sure the connector "keys" are correct ( Figure 85).
Insert tool, Cummins Part No. 3822759, in the number one hole of the connector. Make sure the tool is pushed to the bottom of the cavity ( Figure 86).

figure.caption: Make Sure Tool is Pushed to Bottom of Cavity

step1.para: Insert the wire labeled number 1 into the number one hole of the connector of the connector body. Remove the tool. Push the wire into the cavity until it "clicks" into position ( Figure 87).
Tug on the wire. The terminal must hold the wire in the connector ( Figure 88).
Repeat steps 7 through 9 to insert all of the wires into the connector body cavities.
Install new plastic wire ties, Cummins Part No. 3822925, under the cover ( Figure 89). Install the cover on the connector body. Insert the tabs in the slots. Snap the locking tabs on the cover.
Install a new plastic wire tie, Part No. 3822924, through the cover and around the rear of the connector ( Figure 90).

figure.caption: Install New Plastic Wire Tie Through Cover

step1.para: When all wires are inserted into connector, make sure the terminals were not damaged during replacement. Inspect the connector for "pushed back" or "expanded" terminals, using a special tool, Cummins Part No. 3823383 ( Figure 91). Insert the tool into each AMP connector terminal. Do not force the tool into the terminal.

figure.caption: Insert Tool into Each AMP Connector Terminal

step1.para: A terminal that is not pushed back or expanded will have a surface to tool gap ( Figure 91) of approximately 0.050 in. (1.3 mm). If the tool touches the connector (without forcing), replace the terminal.

In this step, push the tool into the terminal until the tool touches the connector ( Figure 92), then slowly remove the tool from the terminal. A small resistance (6 to 10 oz.) must be felt. If some resistance is not felt, the terminal is expanded and must be replaced.
Repeat Steps 13 and 14 checking for "pushed back" or "expanded" terminals for each terminal in the connector. If repair is required, refer to 28-Way Connector - Repairing Terminals.
